apply_settings.description: A map of Puppet settings to use when applying Puppet code.

show_diff.description: Whether to log and report a contextual diff when files are being replaced.

color.description: Whether to use colored output when printing messages to the console.

compile-concurrency.description: The maximum number of simultaneous manifest block compiles.

concurrency.description: The number of threads to use when executing on remote targets.

format.description: The format to use when printing results.

hiera-config.description: The path to your Hiera config.

inventoryfile.description: The path to your inventory file.

log.description: The configuration of the logfile output. Configuration can be set for console and the path to a log file, such as ~/.puppetlabs/bolt/debug.log.

console.description: Configuration for logs output to the console.

level.description: The type of information in the log.

additionalProperties.description: Configuration for logs output to a file.

append.description: Add output to an existing log file.

level.description: The type of information in the log.

modulepath.description: The module path for loading tasks and plan code. This is either an array of directories or a string containing a list of directories separated by the OS-specific PATH separator.

plugin_hooks.description: Which plugins a specific hook should use.

puppet_library.description: Specify which plugin should be used to ensure the Puppet library is installed on a target.

plugins.description: A map of plugins and their configuration data.

puppetdb.description: A map containing options for configuring the Bolt PuppetDB client.

cacert.description: The path to the ca certificate for PuppetDB.

cert.description: The path to the client certificate file to use for authentication.

key.description: The path to the private key for the certificate.

server_urls.description: An array containing the PuppetDB host to connect to. Include the protocol https and the port, which is usually 8081. For example, https://my-master.example.com:8081.

puppetfile.description: A map containing options for the 'bolt puppetfile install' command.

forge.description: A subsection that can have its own proxy setting to set an HTTP proxy for Forge operations only, and a baseurl setting to specify a different Forge host.

baseurl.description: The URI for the Forge host.

proxy.description: The HTTP proxy to use for Forge operations.
The HTTP proxy to use for Git and Forge operations.

save-rerun.description: Whether to update .rerun.json in the Bolt project directory. If your target names include passwords, set this value to false to avoid writing passwords to disk.

trusted-external-command.description: The path to an executable on the Bolt controller that can produce external trusted facts.
